channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 26th January
item.description:
Customer recently reported pothole and repairs were complete, however the hole has reappeared exactly as it was before (possibly due to rains)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes still not fixed- hall rd, 26th January
item.description:
Please fix the multiple potholes the end of hall road. They are getting worse!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Hall Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This was “repaired” in November. We all assumed they would be coming back to complete the works but nobody did. It appears to be signed off now, so I am flagging it as a new report. It’s a complete mess., 26th January
item.description:
Kingscroft Road Hucclecote GL3 3RG, opposite number 31 just by junction with Porchester Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingscroft Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole, 26th January

item.title: Pothole near Asda Garage, 26th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve

Springbank community centre bus There’s no bus stop shelter at this stop …

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springbank Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

Pothole around gully breaking out ,holes

item.title: This is a pothole that has been filled previously and now back again in less than 3 months., 26th January
item.description:
This rd is covered in potholes. Dangerous and damaging to cars. This rd needs to be resurfaced in many places. This pothole is right on the junction and wide and deep. Attention to it is needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ullenwood Manor Lane, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right in the middle of the road. Wide and deep pothole., 26th January
item.description:
This is a major problem to traffic. In the middle of the road where cars are parked each side so you have to drive over it. Busy junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Edinburgh Place, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously reported SERIES of pot holes between Foxcote Grange entrance and Chapel Cottage Foxcote., 26th January
item.description:
Series of deep potholes prev. reported on lane between Foxcote Grange + Chapel Cottage. 1 repaired (not worst), others deteriorated further. Issues - single track, no alt. route, no street lights, road surface bowed due to edge sinking, exacerbating issue. Size varies - worst 4' x 2' x 9". Others 6" deep ++.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous large and deep potholes, 26th January
item.description:
The road is absolutely littered with potholes that are repeatedly subject to poor repair, or are ignored when some are filled. The road is cracking and subsiding along its entire length and is becoming hazardous to drive along. It really needs to be entirely resurfaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on Leyson Road, 26th January
item.description:
The entrance to Leyson Road cul de sac has multiple pot holes, some have been filled in over the years but don't last and appear to just help to creat further holes in the winter due to uneven road surface. The whole road entrance needs to be resurfaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Leyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 26th January
item.description:
NWD GIVE AND TAKE PLEASE BRING X3 BARRIERS AND X3 SANDBAGS PLACE AROUND RAISED STEEL COVER OVER SELLER COVER TO MAKE SAFE (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Innsworth Lane by lamppost no88 bus stop, 26th January
item.description:
Corner of Rookery Road/ Innsworth Lane bin needs emptying as just the top layer gets emptied. Lots of cans,bottles and paper amongst the hedgerows and kerbs. Around the bin on the bus stop and opposite side of road as become full of litter recently. It’s an eyesore at the moment due to all the litter on the pavement etc…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
